sentences.en: He had an intuition that there was something wrong.
sentences.cn: 他凭直觉知道有些地方不对劲.

sentences.en: He knew this thing by intuition.
Her intuition was telling her that something was wrong.
sentences.cn: 她的直觉告诉她一定出了什么问题。
他的直觉常常是正确的.

sentences.en: His intuition tells him the snake is beautiful and noble.
sentences.cn: 他直觉地知道蛇是美丽的,高尚的.

sentences.en: I had an intuition that I would find you.
sentences.cn: 我有一种直觉,我能找到你们.

sentences.en: I had an intuition that something awful was about to happen.
sentences.cn: 我直觉感到要出乱子了。

sentences.en: I had to call on intuition plus luck.
sentences.cn: 我只有依靠我的直觉和运气了.

sentences.en: Intuition told her it was unwise to argue.
sentences.cn: 直觉告诉她争吵是不理智的。

sentences.en: Intuition told me you were here.
sentences.cn: 我凭直觉知道你在这儿.

sentences.en: It was said in a flash of intuition.
sentences.cn: 这话是凭一刹那的直觉说出的.

sentences.en: She had an intuition that her friend was ill.
sentences.cn: 她有一种直觉:她的朋友病了.

sentences.en: She sensed what was wrong by intuition.
sentences.cn: 她凭直觉意识到什么地方出毛病了.

sentences.en: The net effects on nations may clash with intuition.
sentences.cn: 对各国的净影响,可能与直觉知识背道而驰.

sentences.en: This intuition is his private affair.
sentences.cn: 这种直觉是他个人的事情.

sentences.en: With his knowledge, experience and scientific intuition, he could see them clearly.
sentences.cn: 凭着他的知识 、 经验和科学上的直觉, 他可以清楚地看见它们.

words.tran_cn: [心理]直觉；直觉力；直觉的知识

trans.tran_cn: 直觉，凭直觉感知的知识，直觉力
trans.tran_en: the ability to understand or know something because of a feeling rather than by considering the facts
